newsitem.title: USA: GelTex calls RenaGel trial results positive.
newsitem.headline: GelTex calls RenaGel trial results positive.

text.p: GelTex Pharmaceuticals Inc said on Wednesday its phase III clinical trial of RenaGel to treat chronic kidney failure patients to control elevated phosphorus levels was positive.
The study demonstrated that RenaGel significantly decreased serum phosphorus without increasing serum calcium, the company said.

In parallel with the change in serum phosphorus levels, RenaGel treatment also produced significant decreases in blood levels of parathyroid hormone, a key contributor to renal bone disease, the company said.
There were no serious drug-related adverse events reported in this study, GelTex said.
High phosphorus levels in chronic kidney failure patients trigger an increase in parathyroid hormone which leads to bone degradation, increased calcium levels and renal bone disease, GelTex said.
Established therapies control phosphorus levels at the expense of increased calcium levels, the company said.
GelTex said it remains on track for a New Drug Application filing with the Food and Drug Administration by the fourth quarter of 1997.
